comments.author: Die_empty
comments.body: Quote from: jvanname on January 09, 2023, 07:09:09 PMNearly every person who I communicate with is angry and hateful. No. They are not even angry at the correct things. In fact, when I bring up the correct things up, they spew hatred and anger towards me. Please stop it. Is is very bad!How do you know that what you tell people is correct? What you think is correct might not be acceptable based on the person's perception or belief. I would suggest you ask people the reason for their anger and hatefulness. Don't just generalize that nearly everybody is hateful because this belief is very far from the truth. You should openhearted hear people's views and accept some helpful information instead of generalizing.Â There is a saying that a hungry man is an angry man. In my country, people are going through a whole lot of financial challenges. Most people have to survive on a meal per day because of the financial crisis ravaging the world. You don't expect such people to be happy. The only thing that can make them happy for now is financial empowerment. But it is also important to treat people right. Regardless of the problem one is facing, let us ensure we control our emotions because it could be dangerous. Anger and hate are the major causes of violence in our societies, hence they need to be controlled or reduced to a large extent.
